RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 76. Claiming Purse 11000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 7 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000. (If necessary will be run SAME DISTANCE Main Track.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WARRIOR EMPRESS came in cutting off rivals soon after the break, tightened rival on rail into the turn clearing there cutting the corner into upper stretch widening there holding safe to wire. STRADARI sent hard was tightened along the rail into the turn chasing to upper stretch angling out to the three path there finishing well. UNTOUCHED ELEGANCE slow early swung out to upper stretch gaining some position while six wide. CANELITA was in tight being bumped steadying briefly after the break, chased on the turn tiring in upper stretch. RISATA was cut off steadying briefly after the break, chased on the turn tiring in upper stretch. EVER SO D'WILD was always outrun. OBJECTIONS FROM THE RIDERS OF STRADARI FOR INTERFERENCE INTO THE TURN AND RISATA FOR INTERFERENCE AFTER THE BREAK WERE LODGED AGAINST WARRIOR EMPRESS, THE RISATA CLAIM WAS UPHELD AND WARRIOR EMPRESS WAS DISQUALIFIED AND PLACED FIFTH.

ENTRY.NAME: Stradari
ENTRY.COMMENT: sent hard, tightened on rail to turn, angled out lane second best

ENTRY.NAME: Ever So d'Wild
ENTRY.COMMENT: always outrun,

ENTRY.NAME: Untouched Elegance
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, swung out to lane, gained position 6 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Canelita
ENTRY.COMMENT: in tight bumped steadied briefly after break, chased, tired,

ENTRY.NAME: Risata
ENTRY.OWNER: S B Stables LLC and Thorough Crowd
ENTRY.COMMENT: cut off steadied after the break, chased on turn, tired lane

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Warrior Empress
ENTRY.COMMENT: cut off rivals after break, clear turn, cut corner lane, driving,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 2 6F Dirt CR: 73. Claiming Purse 12400. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 7 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500 (W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eligibility). (If n ecessary will be run SIX FURLONGS Main Track.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LILLY CHROME came out bumping rival at the break, surged along the inside near the quarter pole taking the lead in upper stretch drawing clear gamely. TEAM HOT LINE pressed the pace taking a short lead on the turn being engaged from the inside in upper stretch proving no match late. LIKELY CHOICE bumped at the break came seven wide in upper stretch finishing evenly. DETAILED pressed on the turn extending in upper stretch fading late. AN OBJECTION FROM THE RIOER OF LIKELY CHOICE AGAINST THE RIDER OF TEAM HOT LINE FOR INTERFERENCE AT THE START WAS DISMISSED BY THE STEWARDS.

ENTRY.NAME: Detailed
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed on the turn, dueled top lane, faded late

ENTRY.NAME: Lilly Chrome
ENTRY.COMMENT: came out bumping break, surged inside turn, drew clear gamely,

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: New Dawn Stable, LLC & Deo Volente Farms

ENTRY.NAME: Likely Choice
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break, very wide top lane, finished evenly,

ENTRY.NAME: Team Hot Line
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, led on turn, dueled lane, no match

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 82. Claiming Purse 14200. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 7 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500 (W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eligibility). (If necessary will be run SIX FURLONGS Main Track.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BLUEBERRY surged to the lead along the inside on the turn kicking clear in upper stretch winning as much the best. WHISKYFORBREAKFAST away alertly set the early pace ceding to inside rival on the turn being dispatched in upper stretch holding others well safe from the rail. AGADOR SPARTACUS chased early then weakened on the turn fading to upper stretch. BLOODPROF folded up on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Blueberry
ENTRY.COMMENT: surged to lead inside on turn, drew off driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Bloodprof
ENTRY.COMMENT: folded up on the turn

ENTRY.NAME: Whiskyforbreakfast
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, set pace, ceded on turn, no match inside lane

ENTRY.NAME: Agador Spartacus
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased early, weakened on turn, faded lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 4 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 47. Maiden Special Weight Purse 16500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 116 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. (Preference To Horses That Have Not Started For Less Than $15,000).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAC DADDY rushed up to vie on the turn dueling three deep in upper stretch drawing out near mid track late. SWORD OF DAMOCLES broke slowly rushing to contention pressing inside of riivals through the turn into upper stretch coming out in mid stretch bumping foe in the process running on as second best. WHY WINCHILL WHY chased early dropping off on the turn racing evenly down the lane moving up a bit. PORTIA'S HOPE pressed the pace dueling between horses in upper stretch being bumped and crowded in mid stretch dropping off late. BANK CARD slow early saved ground playing no factor. CLASSY REY DE ORO faded on the turn. AN OBJECTION FROM THE RIDER OF PORTIA'S HOPE AGAINST THE RIDER OF SWORD OF DAMOCIES FOR INTERFERENCE DURING THE STRETCH RUN WAS DISMISSED BY THE STEW3ARDS.

ENTRY.NAME: Bank Card
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, saved ground, no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Portia's Hope
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, dueled between, bumped crowded mid stretch

ENTRY.NAME: Sword of Damocles
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke slowly, rushed to contention, dueled inside, bumped foe

ENTRY.NAME: Classy Rey de Oro
ENTRY.OWNER: Miotke Elise Miotke Matthew and Energy Racing Stable LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: faded on the turn

ENTRY.NAME: Why Winchill Why
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace, dropped off on turn, finished evenly,

ENTRY.NAME: Mac Daddy
ENTRY.OWNER: O'Sullivan Farms LLC and Funkhouser John
ENTRY.COMMENT: rushed up on turn, bid three deep top lane, drew off,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 5 1M Dirt CR: 73. Claiming Purse 7900. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE AUGUST 7, 2022 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 116 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ICONIC went evenly through the far turn surging into upper stretch drawing clear from mid track. FIND YOUR BOAZ in tight at the break raced wide throughout bidding from the eight path down the lane gamely saving place. ARTEMUS EAGLE stalked the pace chasing to upper stretch weakening late. PERCENTAGE sent clear set the pace through the far turn being hooked in upper stretch wearing under pressure. BLUE SKY PAINTER slow early played no factor. PICCADILLY BEAU tracked the pace weakening on the far turn. CAPTAIN RILEY raced evenly through the far turn tiring in upper stretch. BARELYSTILLCOUNTS was never involved. PEAR LEMONADE was always outrun.

ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace, weakened far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Barelystillcounts
ENTRY.COMMENT: never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Blue Sky Painter
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Iconic
ENTRY.COMMENT: evenly, surged to lane, drew clear mid track

ENTRY.NAME: Find Your Boaz
ENTRY.COMMENT: in tight break, lost ground, bid eight wide lane, saved placed

ENTRY.NAME: Artemus Eagle
ENTRY.OWNER: Nana's Nest and Cline Robert C
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, chased to lane, weakened late

ENTRY.NAME: Pear Lemonade
ENTRY.COMMENT: always outrun,

ENTRY.NAME: Captain Riley
ENTRY.COMMENT: evenly, tired lane

ENTRY.NAME: Percentage
ENTRY.COMMENT: sent clear, set pace, hooked top lane, faded

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 6 5F Dirt CR: 67. Claiming Purse 7900. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 7 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: OFFUTT COLE pressed the pace dueling between horses on the turn extending past mid track down the lane being carried out late getting up gamely. BILLINGSGATE pressured the pace dueling on the inside through the turn taking a clear lead in upper stretch angling out late to tighten wide rival ceding in the closing yards. CUPID'S NUMBER a step slow early lagged through the turn racing mid track down the lane finishing evenly. DADDY Z slow early raced inside to upper stretch splitting horses late on the inside to move up some. ELUSIVE MOTION chased early racing four deep on the turn fading in upper stretch. FROSTED WHITE FACE was never involved. FULL AHEAD pressured the pace through the turn tiring the final eighth. BAYTOWN JAKESTER raced evenly through the turn giving way in upper stretch.

ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, inside to lane, split horses, mild gain

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 66. Claiming Purse 8300. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE AUGUST 7, 2022. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 7 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eli gibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FIANNA HILLS away alertly set the pace on a clear lead through the turn, angled four wide in upper stretch was all out late to hold on. RORAIMA slow early rallied on the turn bidding from mid track down the lane gaining in the closing yards. GRAY FASHION stalked the pace vying along the inside down the stretch hanging late. CAPTAIN ANNE slow early gave a mild rally on the turn vying in upper stretch finishing evenly. OUR FLIRTATION faded on the turn. SHANNON'S GIRL was always outrun.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 8 6F Dirt CR: 80. Claiming Purse 8300. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE FEBRUARY 7, 2023. Three Year Olds, 116 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: THE FILTER surged four deep on the turn wresting the lead in upper stretch digging in late holding on inside of foe. KREWE CHIEF pressed up on the turn surging mid stretch hooking foe late missing abreast rival at the wire. UNION BROTHER hustled along chased to upper stretch bidding four wide down the lane finishing well. ROYAL SQUEEZE slow early surged on the rail to upper stretch extending late being outfinished. FLIMFLAM MAN slow early played no factor. JOHNNY U faded on the turn. HE'S THE SOUPERWON pressured the pace through the turn wilting in upper stretch. JUSTIN FRONT pressed through the turn giving way in upper stretch.
